name: Corey Waxman
tagline: Doctoral Student, Hara Lab, Tokyo Institute of Technology
body:
### Research
My research interests are reconfigurable computing, FPGAs, and Electronic Design Automation (EDA).  In particular, I am currently focusing on languages for digital hardware design.

### Education
* Doctoral student, Information & Communications Engineering, Tokyo Institute of Technology (expected 2022)
* MSE, Electrical Engineering, University of Pennsylvania (2011)
* BS, Computer Engineering, Binghamton University (2007)

### Employment
* Jan 2020 - Mar 2020 | Fixstars Corporation | Software Development Engineer (part-time)
* Oct 2019 - Nov 2019 | Fixstars Corporation | Software Development Intern
* Feb 2017 - Sep 2018 | Synopsys, Inc. | R&D Engineer
* Jun 2013 - Jun 2016 | Israel Defense Forces | Electronics Engineer 
* Jan 2013 - Jun 2013 | Cigol Digital Systems | Verification Engineer
* Sep 2007 - Sep 2009 | Lockheed Martin IS&GS | Integration / Test Engineer
* Jun 2007 - Aug 2007 | Air Force Research Laboratory (AFRL) | Student Contractor
* Apr 2003 - May 2007 | Binghamton University Enginet | Control Room Operator

### Publications
* Saugata Ghose, Latoya Gilgeous, Polina Dudnik, Aneesh Aggarwal, Corey Waxman.  _Architectural Support for Low Overhead Detection of Memory Violations_. Design, Automation, and Test in Europe (DATE) 2009.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
